JUDGES: Giovanni Bonello;Lech Garlicki;Ledi Bianku;Nebojša Vučinić;Nicolas Bratza;Päivi Hirvelä
TEXT: The applicants , PERSON , PERSON , PERSON PERSON PERSON and Mr PERSON , are NORP nationals who were born in DATE , DATE , DATE and DATE respectively and live in GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , Mr PERSON of ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
The applicants are co - owners of property in GPE , which they inherited from their late father and grandfather PERSON , who died in DATE .

On DATE ORG ( PERSON ) adopted a general local development plan which stipulated , among other things , that an electricity supply line was to be constructed over the applicants’ property . For that reason there was a “ reserve ” of QUANTITY created on several properties , including part of the applicants’ property .
In DATE ORG announced that it was intending to adopt amendments to the existing land development plan .
On DATE the applicants lodged an objection ( zarzut ) to the proposed amendments .
On DATE , by a resolution , ORG rejected the applicants’ objection .
On an unspecified date the applicants lodged a complaint against that resolution with ORG ( PERSON ) .
On DATE ORG quashed the challenged resolution and declared it null and void .

In the meantime , on DATE , although the ORG complaint to ORG was still pending , ORG passed further amendments to the local development plan adopted in DATE and excluded from the plan the plots of land owned by the applicants .
The applicants lodged a complaint against that resolution with ORG .

On CARDINAL DATE ORG declared the resolution null and void in the part challenged by the applicants . The court found that adopting a local development plan with an exclusion of some properties situated on the line of the planned investment amounted to a violation of certain provisions of the DATE LAW ( ustawa o zagospodarowaniu przestrzennym ) .
Having obtained CARDINAL ORG judgments in their favour , on DATE the applicants requested the President of GPE to present them with a schedule of measures to end the reserve .

On DATE they received a letter from the Chief PERSON of GPE ( PERSON ) who informed them that , in spite of the judgments given by ORG , the reserve remained in force and that a procedure for withdrawal of the reserve might be instituted after the adoption of a new resolution outlining a study of the local development plan ( studium uwarunkowan i kierunków zagospodarowania przestrzennego ) . The architect did not , however , specify any date or time - limit within which the planned study would be prepared .
On DATE the local development plan of DATE expired .
DATE the applicants sent numerous letters and complaints to various authorities , but these were ineffective .
On DATE the applicants informed the ORG that the GPE authorities had announced a draft of the study which did not contain a “ reserve ” for the electricity line .
On DATE the applicants lodged a request with ORG ( Sąd Rejonowy ) for dissolution of the co - ownership of their property .
The proceedings were stayed on several occasions and the applicants lodged several requests for the exclusion of judges sitting in their case . Their requests were dismissed as ill - founded .

On DATE ORG rejected the ORG request , finding that other proceedings for dissolution of coownership and division of property inherited from the late FAC , concerning the same property and instituted by the applicants had been pending since DATE . The applicants did not appeal against that decision .
On DATE ORG resumed the proceedings referred to in its decision of DATE .
On DATE ORG gave a preliminary decision in which it established the shares of particular heirs in the estate of the late F.P.
On DATE ORG confirmed the distribution of the estate as set out in the preliminary decision of DATE .
The applicants did not appeal .

The relevant domestic law and practice concerning local development plans are set out in the ORG ’s judgments in the cases of PERSON v. GPE , no . CARDINAL , § CARDINAL - CARDINAL and § CARDINAL , DATE , and GPE v. GPE , no . CARDINAL , § CARDINAL , DATE .
